MAN.TITLE: surface_properties

DESCRIPTION.P: The Surface entity is a leaf of the graphics entities hierarchy. Two classes appears under this type of entity : Plot3d and Fac3d according to the ploting function.

This entity is still under developpement and will problably evolve a lot. In particular we intend to extend the Axes data structure to 3D and split the Axes propteies and Surface drawing properties similarily to the 2D case.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: visible:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This field contains the visible property value for the entity . It should be "on" or "off" . By default, surfaces are visibles, the value's property is "on" . If "off" the 3D graphics are not displayed on the screen.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: data:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This field is not yet available. It will be define a matrix data of a row and column indices of each element as the x- and y-coordinates and the value of each element as the z-coordinate.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: data_bounds:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This field contains the boundary values for the x, y and z coordinates. It is the matrix [xmin,xmax;ymin,ymax;zmin,zmax].

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: flags:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: a real vector of size three flag=[mode,type,box] where:

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: mode: a string (treatment of hidden parts).
If mode>0 the hidden parts of the surface are removed and the surface is painted with color "mode".
if mode=0 the hidden parts of the surface are drawn.
if mode<0 only the backward facing facets are painted with color or pattern id "-mode".
if type=0 the plot is made using the current 3D scaling (set by a previous call to param3d, plot3d, contour or plot3d).
if type=1 rescales automatically 3d boxes with extreme aspect ratios, the boundaries are specified by the value of the property data_bounds.
if type=2 rescales automatically 3d boxes with extreme aspect ratios, the boundaries are computed using the given data.
if type=3 3d isometric with box bounds given by the property data_bounds.
if type=4 3d isometric bounds are derived from the data.
if type=5 3d expanded isometric bounds with box bounds are given by the property data_bounds.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: thickness:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This field contains the default thickness value of the lines used to draw the axes and the facets contours. It should be a positive integer.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: foreground:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This field contains the color index used to draw the axes and the facets contours. Its value should be a color index (relative to the current colormap).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: rotation_angles:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This field is the vector [theta,alpha]. These two values give the spherical coordinates of the observation points (in degree).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: color_flag:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This field is used to specify the algorithm used to set facets' colors.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: If color_flag== then all facets are painted using the color index defined by flag(1) (see above).

If color_flag== then all facets are painted using the color index proportional to z. The minimum z value is painted using the index 1 color while The maximum z value is painted using highest color index.
If color_flag== then all facets are painted using the color index given in the surface_color property (one color per facet).
This option is available only with Fac3d entity type.
If color_flag== then facets painting results of interpolation of facet boundary colors. The facet boundary colors indices are given in the surface_color property (one color per facet boundary).
This option is available only with Fac3d entity type.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: surface_color:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: If color_flag is equal to 2 or 3 this property contains the index of the color used to paint facets.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: If color_flag== then the property value is a vector of indices. One color index per facet.
If color_flag== then the property value is a matrix of indices. One column per facet and for each facet one color index is given for each boundary.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: parent:
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: This property contains the handle of the parent. The parent of the surface entity should be of the type "Axes".
